New Records: England become the first men's side to hold both the 50-over and T20 World Cups at the same time.
Key Match Events: England seal their second T20 World Cup triumph.
Sam Curran was the standout performer with a three-for in the final and was chosen as Player of the Tournament.
Ben Stokes hit the winning runs in the final and scored his first 50 in T20Is.
Wasim yorks Moeen Ali in the 18.2 overs, adding a twist in the tale.
Haris Rauf bowled a tight over, conceding only six runs in the 18th over.
Post-Match Reflections: Moeen Ali called it the best day of his life.
Ben Stokes' redemption arc from the 2016 final to hitting the winning runs in 2022.
England's brand of attacking cricket has transformed the way the game is played in this format.
Plaudits pour in for England's white-ball cricket achievements since 2015.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan's performance with the ball was heroic but they were desperately unlucky.
